content: In the tightly controlled city of Stenograd, where the Behavioral Compliance Index quietly governed every aspect of life, order began to unravel after the mysterious death of Marek Halden, the architect of the system. Sensing an opportunity, Rada Miskovic leaked the Council’s secret dossiers, unveiling to shocked citizens how promotions were engineered by algorithms, trust betrayed, and warnings about loyalty suppressed. As the damning files spread, outrage grew: Council meetings exploded in accusations and the city erupted in protest, demanding resignations and true elections. While factions turned on each other behind sealed doors, the city grappled loudly with questions of legitimacy, power, and what kind of future Stenograd would choose now that the veil of perfect order had been torn away.
